bio: Oleksandr was born in Ukraine and grew up in Argentina. He now lives and works in France.
artistStatement-01: As a self-taught artist, I create theatrical still-life compositions that explore the interplay of light, shadow, and narrative. By transforming ordinary objects—figurines, plants, and domestic items—into intimate vignettes, I evoke curiosity and quiet reflection, imbuing each piece with a sense of mystery and untold stories.
artistStatement-02: Using layered oil paints, I explore themes of stillness, nostalgia, and connection, offering spaces for viewers to reflect and uncover their own interpretations.
artistStatement-03: Rooted in my surroundings and personal experience, my work bridges the familiar and the universal, revealing beauty in simplicity and stillness.
